title: Firefox crashes everytime I try to upload a file
content: This is my crash report https://crash-stats.mozilla.org/report/index/9ff24288-5f5b-4ad1-ac89-2b1180240805 please help on how to solve this
creator: arghya139

title: Text is blurry in Firefox when I am viewing on an external monitor.
content: Text is blurry in Firefox when I am viewing on an external monitor. All Windows dialogs look normal and Chrome and Edge look fine. Only Firefox seems to have the problem. I am using the latest version of Firefox as far as I am aware (auto-update is turned on). The OS is Windows 11. The external monitor is set to 2560x1440 resolution and fonts are scaled to 125%. I'm not sure what other settings are important. I don't see setting in Firefox that seems likely to help.
creator: me-ffs_01

title: Tabs sent to sidebar reload on opening and closing
content: I have been using addons, that allow opening web pages in sidebar, and all share a similar drawback, which is why I believe it to be on the browser side. When I close the sidebar and open it again, the page gets reloaded. This makes using messengers etc. in sidebar much less comfortable. I noticed, however, that bookmarks and history, when opened in sidebar, remember the state the were in when last closed. Is there some simple way to make pages remember their state as well or it can only be done by changing the addons' or the browser's code?
creator: alkir-2

title: View source shows different page html to source code in both normal and private browsing
content:
I am developing a website and when troubleshooting I am getting the following issue in both private browsing and normal browser mode.

- 'my_watchlist' html page loads in the both browser mode windows as it should - in both browser mode windows, view source code shows a dashboard page html and not the my_watchlist page html - inspect shows the correct html code for the my_watchlist page in both browser mode windows

The reason this is an issue is because I am not getting changes made to the source code in the my_watchlist page showing after saving and uploading to the server.

To clarify, I have tried: - closing browsers completely and reopening - still same issue - clearing cache - same issue - restarting pc - same issue

What is causing this?

Thanks.
creator: kerin_chris

title: Firefox Update 129.0
content: This current update (129.0) crashed my windows 10 pc. Firefox showed that the update was completed and restarted itself. Nvidia downloaded a driver update & attempted to install it but failed. The error msg indicated that another app update was in progress, prevented it from installing, and to try later. Based on what I saw on Task Manager, Firefox locked up the windows installer module and had 100% disk usage. PC then crashed and looped several times trying to auto-repair itself. Had to do a hard power down, a safe boot, and the restore PC and Windows 10 to last good version. Will not do any Firefox updates until this problem is resolved.
creator: vj000000

title: Latest update
content: HULU stopped playing any live tv or anything after Firefox just updated. It works just fine on Edge!

title: Weird Green flashing cursor in top left of firefox screen

title: Firefox update broke Hulu
content: After Firefox update on August 6, 2024, I cannot use Hulu video streaming. There is a black screen. Rolling back to 128.0.3 solves the problem. Will there be a fix so that I can update Firefox to the latest version?
creator: erica.j.kilian
